thread.title: Sports digest: United States men's soccer team might miss Olympics
thread.title_full: Sports digest: United States men's soccer team might miss Olympics

author: Associated Press
title: Sports digest: United States men's soccer team might miss Olympics
text:
Sports digest: United States men's soccer team might miss Olympics Associated Press Posted: 10/10/2015 07:40:07 PM PDT Updated: 10/10/2015 07:40:08 PM PDT The United States is in danger of missing its second straight men's Olympic soccer tournament. 
Alberth Elis scored in the 24th and 77th minutes, and Honduras beat the U.S. 2-0 Saturday in Sandy, Utah, to qualify for next year's Rio de Janeiro Games. 
To reach the Olympics for the first time since 2008, the Americans must beat Mexico or Canada on Tuesday in the third-place game of North and Central American and Caribbean qualifying, then defeat Colombia in the CONCACAF-South American one-game playoff, to be played in Rio from March 21-29. 
"We were not able to deal with the situation today," U.S. coach Andi Herzog said. "It's sad, but it's the truth." 
Olympic qualifying is limited to under-23 teams, and the Americans were eliminated four years ago in the group stage. 
Michel Platini lodged an appeal with FIFA against his 90-day suspension and was backed by the South American confederation, which called for the European soccer leader to be allowed to stand in the presidential election to succeed Sepp Blatter. 
CONMEBOL's intervention comes ahead of a FIFA executive committee meeting later this month that is poised to discuss whether to delay the Feb. 26 emergency presidential election. 
The Confederation of African Football says Issa Hayatou's kidney illness will not prevent him from carrying out his full duties as acting FIFA president in Blatter's absence. Hayatou, 69, requires regular dialysis sessions. Advertisement 
Despite a 2-0 defeat to Bosnia-Herzegovina, Wales reached its first international tournament since the 1958 World Cup thanks to Cyprus beating Israel 2-1. Seconds after the match in Bosnia ended, Wales learned that the result in Jerusalem had booked it a place at next year's European Championship in France Also qualifying were Italy and Belgium. 
Didier Drogba scored on a 30-yard free kick, Evan Bush made a late diving save and the Montreal Impact beat the host Colorado Rapids 1-0. Montreal increased its lead to four points over seventh-place Orlando City for the final MLS Eastern Conference playoff position. 
With Montreal's victory, expansion New York City FC was eliminated from playoff contention. Basketball Tamika Catchings and her Indiana Fever teammates face elimination Sunday night in Game 4 of the WNBA Finals in Indianapolis. The Minnesota Lynx hold a 2-1 lead in the best-of-five series. 
"It's almost like crawling, scratching, whatever you have to do to win," Catchings said of the team's mentality. Tennis Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal will renew their long rivalry in the China Open final Sunday in Beijing after both won their semifinals in straight sets. 
The top-ranked Djokovic improved his record at the tournament to 28-0 with a 6-2, 6-3 victory over David Ferrer of Spain. Nadal defeated Italy's Fabio Fognini 7-5, 6-3. 
Unseeded Benoit Paire of France beat defending champion Kei Nishikori 1-6, 6-4, 6-2 to advance to the Japan Open final in Tokyo where he faces top-seeded Stan Wawrinka. 
Venus Williams entered the Hong Kong Open, her last chance to qualify for the season-ending WTA finals in Singapore. The WTA finals feature the top eight players in the Race to Singapore rankings based on this year's results. Williams is 11th, but because sister Serena is sitting out the remainder of the year, Venus has to make up only two places to qualify. Miscellany Three-time defending national champion Sam Mikulak will miss the world gymnastics championships later this month in Scotland because of an ankle injury. USA Gymnastics said Mikulak injured the ankle while working out in Colorado this week. 
Talco, who had earned a berth in this month's Breeders' Cup Mile at Keeneland, died while undergoing arthroscopic surgery a few days ago.
